title: fiulpro
author: fiulpro
content: This is information for all the people living in the UK or living somewhere close who might have heard of the casino, Bet-at-home, the license has been suspended by the gambling authorities which means it's no longer safe to engage with them. Source :  https://www.gamblinginsider.com/news/17103/gambling-commission-suspends-bet-at-home-licence They failed at 116 of the 2005 Gambling Act. They did fail at social Responsibility and had bad money laundering policies as well. The suspension is in effect immediately as well. You would still be able to access the account and withdraw any money left in there as well, therefore I highly advise people to look at their accounts and close them after withdrawing and look for other options as well.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: If it was true that they violated certain provisions of the gambling laws, then they must be punished based on the stated provisions of the Act. But it also nice to hear that customers can withdraw their funds without restrictions, that means there would be no loss of funds. But I hope there is no political undertone for this suspension because recently the British government have been clamping down on the activities of gambling companies. They have blamed them for the increase in gambling addiction in the UK. When government fail in their function, they tend to play the blame game. My heart goes to the management and staff of Bet-at-home, I pray the suspension would soon be lifted.

comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: This seems to be a warning to all casinos licensed by the gambling authorities to pay attention to social responsibility issues and money laundering, as casinos can be a place where illegal activities thrive. Moreover, it is a lesson for all casinos who still want to continue their business to strictly follow the advice and rules of the gambling authorities or else their license will be revoked too.For people with accounts at the casino, immediately secure your money there and move it to another safer place before you can't access the account and withdraw your money.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: There is a lack of decentralized casino/gambling websites in the market, If someone covers this part, they will be ultra-rich.Regulations are going to be strict with anything related to crypto, that's pretty obvious, a decentralized system will be really great and will secure anonymity too on the blockchain.

comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on July 10, 2022, 06:26:33 AMThere is a lack of decentralized casino/gambling websites in the market, If someone covers this part, they will be ultra-rich.How can it be decentralised and at the same time make one person rich? I say this because I don't understand it and it doesn't add up. In the case of someone who runs a successful centralised casino, who depends on it, it's clear to me that he can make money, but being decentralised?

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Regulators are more attentive to gambling companies than ever. It must be due to the fact gambling is getting really popular these days with so many people, especially young ones adopting this activity on their daily life for different reasons that go from entertainment to an attempt to make money for a living. Businessmen from gambling industry have no choice besides adapting themselves to the imposed rules, otherwise they aren't going to operate anything on this industry anymore, although there is still the possibility of going anonymous and operating a casino without legal licenses and registers anywhere.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: I hope more publicity is done on this so the news can get to more persons faster. The UK gambling commission seems to be very active and keen on social responsibility and anti-money laundering procedures of the casinos in the country, and it is commendable. Sometime this year as well, a gambling company with the name 888 UK Ltd, that manage over 50 gambling websites were  fined Â£9.4 million  for the same failed social responsibility and anti-money laundering procedures. It is a pointer to other casinos in the UK to ensure they don't breach as well.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Rruchi man on July 10, 2022, 08:02:25 AMI hope more publicity is done on this so the news can get to more persons faster. People that are using the site can be able to access their fund at any time according to the news, the betting site will have to follow the gambling authority instruction which is 'they have to make customers funds available for the respective customers' at any time during the suspension.Secondly is that any customers that is active or not active on the site will not be able bet, that alone should let them know that something is wrong, what will finally happen is that they will find out that the betting site is suspended. If the betting site follow the right way, they would have also messaged their customers to convincingly tell them what is going on, why to be patient and how they are working to solve the issue between them and the regulatory body.The suspension may even be shown even to every person that access the site, especially if the site have a message or notification page that customers can easily see and check.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on July 10, 2022, 06:26:33 AMRegulations are going to be strict with anything related to crypto, that's pretty obvious, a decentralized system will be really great and will secure anonymity too on the blockchain.I'm afraid the suspicion isn't in any way related to crypto. In the first place--and please anybody correct me if I'm wrong--the gambling platform does not support crypto. So this decision by the UKGC is based on something else. As pointed out by the news, while the particular grounds for the suspicion weren't provided, they were basically about social responsibility and AML procedures. And it seems Bet-at-home isn't really more of a victim of a tight gambling regulation. For the past 12 months, it has been in trouble with laws of different countries. The platform also faced legal problems in Austria, Switzerland, Netherlands, Germany.[1] [1] https://www.casino.org/news/online-gambling-site-bet-at-home-loses-uk-license-over-rule-violations/

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: Be nice to know what exactly was failed at.If I had to guess, social responsibility is failure to prevent self-excluded players from creating new accounts, or failure to implement hardcore self exclusion. Think a lot of crypto casinos might be on alert after this.Money laundering, that's probably bad news for players who hate KYC, and more reason for casinos to request them even if not required (since won't know what their threshold is, they'll just wave that AML phrase to justify).

comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: QuoteThe Commission has cited concerns that Bet-at-home has been operating contrary to the terms of the Act and has been in breach of its licence. Areas of particular concern that led to the suspension decision were alleged failings in social responsibility and anti-money laundering procedures.The suspension is in accordance with section 118(2) of the Act, and comes into effect immediately.The Commission said: âWe have made it clear to the operator that during the course of the suspension, we expect it to focus on treating consumers fairly and keeping them fully informed of any developments which impact them.âThe decision to suspend the licence will not prevent Bet-at-home customers from accessing their accounts or withdrawing the available balance, the Commission confirmed.In a statement on its website, Bet-at-home said: âDear players, our operations in the UK have been suspended by the UK Gambling Commission until further notice. You are not able to register, bet, play or deposit with us at the moment.âReading this I think the suspension may not stay long before the whole imbroglio is resolved. If the gambling site has breached the welfare packages and social responsibilities as enshrined in their terms and conditions of contract in letters of the agreement then they can find ways to put their records straight again with their host and the suspension could be lifted.

While majority of the casinos are operating in accordance with the laws from the gambling commission, few are still not abiding the law so they should be warn by this incident.
